solution_line_template: First find how much barbecue sauce Jack makes by adding the volume of each ingredient: {ketchup_cups} cups + {vinegar_cups} cup + {honey_cups} cup = <<{ketchup_cups}+{vinegar_cups}+{honey_cups}={total_sauce_cups}>>{total_sauce_cups} cups

Then multiply the number of pulled pork sandwiches by the amount of sauce per sandwich to find the total amount used: {sauce_per_pulled_pork_fraction} cup/sandwich * {num_pulled_pork_sandwiches} sandwiches = <<{sauce_per_pulled_pork_fraction}*{num_pulled_pork_sandwiches}={sauce_for_pulled_pork}>>{sauce_for_pulled_pork} cups

Then subtract this amount from the total amount of sauce Jack has to find how much he uses on the burgers: {total_sauce_cups} cups - {sauce_for_pulled_pork} cups = <<{total_sauce_cups}-{sauce_for_pulled_pork}={sauce_for_burgers}>>{sauce_for_burgers} cups
Then divide this amount by the amount of sauce used per burger to find the number of burgers he can make: {sauce_for_burgers} cups / {sauce_per_burger_fraction} cup/burger = {num_burgers} burgers
